title: Mahmud Kati
text:
Al Hajj Mahmud Kati (or Mahmoud Kati) (1468? - 1552 or 1593) was an African Muslim scholar. He is traditionally held to be the author of the <a href="West%20Africa">West Africa</a>n chronicle "<a href="Tarikh%20al-fattash">Tarikh al-fattash</a>", though the authorship is contested.
Kati grew up in <a href="Kurmina">Kurmina</a> but lived most of his adult life in <a href="Timbuktu">Timbuktu</a>. His tomb is the second largest in Timbuktu, after that of <a href="Mohammed%20Bagayogo">Mohammed Bagayogo</a>, and is a site of pilgrimage.
